com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.swing

Enum PInputEventModifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<PInputEventModifier>
      • com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.swing.PInputEventModifier
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<PInputEventModifier>

    public enum PInputEventModifier
extends Enum<PInputEventModifier>
    Key and mouse button modifiers used for input events. This enumeration was created with a few helper methods to clarify the masks provided in the interface InputEvent.

    Certain, obsolete values are intentionally missing from this enum:

    • InputEvent.SHIFT_MASK
    • InputEvent.CTRL_MASK
    • InputEvent.META_MASK
    • InputEvent.ALT_MASK
    • InputEvent.ALT_GRAPH_MASK
    All of these values are replaced by their "down" relatives, e.g., InputEvent.SHIFT_DOWN_MASK.
    Author:
    Kevin Connor ARPE (kevinarpe@gmail.com)
    See Also:
    InputEvent

      static class  PInputEventModifier.ModifierType
      Denotes the type of modifier: PInputEventModifier.ModifierType.KEY or PInputEventModifier.ModifierType.MOUSE_BUTTON

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      ALT_DOWN_MASK
      Represents the Alt key pressed down.
      ALT_GRAPH_DOWN_MASK
      Represents the Alt Graph key pressed down.
      BUTTON1_DOWN_MASK
      Represents the left mouse button pressed down.
      BUTTON2_DOWN_MASK
      Represents the middle mouse button pressed down.
      BUTTON3_DOWN_MASK
      Represents the right mouse button pressed down.
      CTRL_DOWN_MASK
      Represents the Control key pressed down.
      META_DOWN_MASK
      Represents the Meta key pressed down.
      SHIFT_DOWN_MASK
      Represents the Shift key pressed down.

      • SHIFT_DOWN_MASK

        public static final PInputEventModifier SHIFT_DOWN_MASK
        Represents the Shift key pressed down.
        See Also:
        PInputEventModifier.ModifierType.KEY, InputEvent.SHIFT_DOWN_MASK, KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT

      • CTRL_DOWN_MASK

        public static final PInputEventModifier CTRL_DOWN_MASK
        Represents the Control key pressed down.
        See Also:
        PInputEventModifier.ModifierType.KEY, InputEvent.CTRL_DOWN_MASK, KeyEvent.VK_CONTROL

      • META_DOWN_MASK

        public static final PInputEventModifier META_DOWN_MASK
        Represents the Meta key pressed down.

        Learn more about this key here:

        • http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Meta_key
        • http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Command_key
        On the Apple OS X platform, this value corresponds to the Command key. (Reference)
        See Also:
        PInputEventModifier.ModifierType.KEY, InputEvent.META_DOWN_MASK, KeyEvent.VK_META

      • ALT_DOWN_MASK

        public static final PInputEventModifier ALT_DOWN_MASK
        Represents the Alt key pressed down.

        On the Apple OS X platform, this value corresponds to the Option key. (Reference) Learn more about this key here: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Option_key

        See Also:
        PInputEventModifier.ModifierType.KEY, InputEvent.ALT_DOWN_MASK, KeyEvent.VK_ALT

      • ALT_GRAPH_DOWN_MASK

        public static final PInputEventModifier ALT_GRAPH_DOWN_MASK
        Represents the Alt Graph key pressed down.

        Learn more about this key here: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AltGr_key

        See Also:
        PInputEventModifier.ModifierType.KEY, InputEvent.ALT_GRAPH_DOWN_MASK, KeyEvent.VK_ALT_GRAPH

      • BUTTON1_DOWN_MASK

        public static final PInputEventModifier BUTTON1_DOWN_MASK
        Represents the left mouse button pressed down.

        As mouse button masks have no associated virtual key code, field keyCode is zero.

        See Also:
        PInputEventModifier.ModifierType.MOUSE_BUTTON, InputEvent.BUTTON1_DOWN_MASK, SwingUtilities.isLeftMouseButton(java.awt.event.MouseEvent)

      • BUTTON2_DOWN_MASK

        public static final PInputEventModifier BUTTON2_DOWN_MASK
        Represents the middle mouse button pressed down.

        As mouse button masks have no associated virtual key code, field keyCode is zero.

        See Also:
        PInputEventModifier.ModifierType.MOUSE_BUTTON, InputEvent.BUTTON2_DOWN_MASK, SwingUtilities.isMiddleMouseButton(java.awt.event.MouseEvent)

      • BUTTON3_DOWN_MASK

        public static final PInputEventModifier BUTTON3_DOWN_MASK
        Represents the right mouse button pressed down.

        As mouse button masks have no associated virtual key code, field keyCode is zero.

        See Also:
        PInputEventModifier.ModifierType.MOUSE_BUTTON, InputEvent.BUTTON3_DOWN_MASK, SwingUtilities.isRightMouseButton(java.awt.event.MouseEvent)

        public static PInputEventModifier valueOfKeyCode(int keyCode)
        Converts an integer constant from KeyEvent, e.g., KeyEvent.VK_ALT, to the corresponding enum value ref. This method only works for enum values where field modifierType is PInputEventModifier.ModifierType.KEY.
        Parameters:
        keyCode - integer constant from KeyEvent, e.g., KeyEvent.VK_ALT
        Returns:
        enum value ref where keyCode equals the parameter, keyCode
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if keyCode does not match field keyCode for any enum value
        See Also:
        keyCode, valueOf(String)
